title: Lesson 73
paragraph: This lesson focuses on emotion and control, including restraint, poise, and judiciousness.

words.example: She spoke in a restrained tone during the meeting.
His response was measured and thoughtful.

words.meaning: moderated in effect; made less intense
words.japaneseMeaning: 和らげられた、調整された
words.example: Her enthusiasm was tempered by caution.

words.meaning: having a composed and self-assured manner
words.japaneseMeaning: 落ち着いた、泰然とした
words.example: He remained poised during the crisis.

words.meaning: being in a state of equilibrium; rational
words.japaneseMeaning: バランスのとれた、公正な
words.example: She offered a balanced perspective on the issue.

words.meaning: not easily disturbed or angered; calm
words.example: His equable demeanor made him a great mediator.
His actions were deliberate and well thought out.

words.meaning: having control of one’s emotions; calm
words.example: She remained composed despite the chaos.
It was a judicious decision to wait.
